document_title: Compensated cirrhosis: Symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Can compensated cirrhosis be cured?
Compensated cirrhosis can be treated. Based on the test results, it is possible to know the progression of cirrhosis through stages, and then have appropriate treatment. Treating compensated cirrhosis is also a way to prevent the disease from turning into decompensated cirrhosis. And in any disease, following your doctor's orders is always the top priority.
Internal medical methods are the main treatment for patients with compensated hepatitis, including: treating the cause if viral hepatitis B, C, D, eliminating liver-damaging agents (alcohol, tobacco, toxic substances,…); Build a healthy diet and rest, get enough nutrients, and limit salt. In addition, there are a number of drugs that can be used when the disease is in the early stages such as diuretics, anti-constipation drugs or anti-fibrotic drugs such as corticoids, colchicine, etc. (3)
